title: BBC Local Live: Shropshire on Friday 17 March 2017 - BBC News
summary: sacked first responder gets her job back .
telford lorry driver charged over m25 death .
plane makes crash landing in field .

documents.title: port vale 2-1 shrewsbury town
text: port vale 2-1 shrewsbury town

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 on monday .

documents.title: football : hughes could return for bradford park avenue game
text: afc telford united are hopeful that striker lee hughes will be back for tomorrow 's match against bradford park avenue at the bucks head .
they 've lost their last two league matches without him , but had a morale-boosting 2-0 win over shrewsbury town in the shropshire senior cup in the week .
victory could see them leapfrog boston united into 15th place in the table .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: volunteer medic reinstated after ambulance trust hears her side of story
text: west midlands ambulance service ( wmas ) said it reversed its decision to sack a community first responder after holding a meeting to `` give her the chance to detail her views on what happened '' .
effie cadwallader from oswestry was dismissed for shredding patient documents - an act which wmas said broke trust procedures and the data protection act .
the ambulance service said it decided `` the value of her services to the community outweighs the circumstances of what happened '' .

documents.title: weather : rain this evening and tomorrow
text: we 're forecast more rain this evening and tomorrow , so you might want to celebrate st patrick 's day indoors - or take an umbrella .
author: Rebecca Wood
BBC Weather

documents.title: council headquarters is 50 today
text: the queen officially opened shropshire council 's shirehall headquarters in shrewsbury 50 years ago today .
the architects designed the buildings around a number of mature trees and the curved outside of the council chamber is finished in portland stone .

paying tribute , architect ralph crowe 's son john said : `` it must be hoped that the qualities of this well specified , designed , built and adaptable municipal building are well enough recognised to see it through the next 50 years at least . ''

documents.title: sunday politics : should shropshire have just one unitary authority ?
text: on the bbc 's sunday politics programme this weekend , we 'll be asking whether shropshire would be better off having just one unitary authority .
the leaders of both shropshire council and telford and wrekin council have so far resisted the idea , but the mp for north shropshire , owen paterson , says it the move could save £ 20m a year .

mr paterson has written to the communities secretary , the bromsgrove mp sajid javid , arguing that `` the continuance of telford and wrekin council is inefficient and has led to unnecessary duplication '' .
he wants mr javid to order a cost benefit analysis of what savings might would accrue from merging the two neighbouring unitaries .
author: BBC Sunday Politics

documents.title: light aircraft makes emergency landing
text: a light aircraft 's made an emergency landing in a field near ellesmere .
the plane came down near kenwick at around 14:00 and eight fire vehicles turned out , along with the ambulance and police .
the pilot walked free , suffering only from shock .
author: Tim Page
News Editor, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: ice hockey : tigers look to end regular season with a victory
text: telford tigers wrap up the regular season at home to milton keynes lightning on sunday , wanting a win against their one-time title rivals .
the tigers are also looking to maintain their 15-game winning run , which stretches back to january and enter the end-of-season play-offs in good form .
watkins will have to wait until the weekend 's games are out of the way , to learn who his side will face in the play-off group stages , which start on wednesday .
it is so important for us to keep our feet moving and keep this train moving along on sunday .
we 've got a great run going and we want to keep that . ''
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: severn valley railway steam gala gets under way
text: the severn valley railway has got its three-day steam gala under way today , with a number of guest locomotives visiting .
as well as all the usual activity , there will be goods trains and brake vans running up and down the tracks and up to 10 different locomotives in action .
there is also be a beer tent at the bewdley station and two new exhibitions at the highley engine house .

documents.title: breakingsacked first responder gets her job back
text: a community first responder who was sacked by west midlands ambulance service because she shredded patient records has been given her job back .
effie cadwallader had been told she had broken trust procedures and the data protection act .
the ambulance service decided to reverse its decision after a meeting with her earlier today .

documents.title: telford lorry driver charged over fatal crash
text: a telford lorry driver has been charged with causing death by dangerous driving , in connection with a fatal crash in essex a year ago .
a nissan note and an hgv collided on the m25 at waltham abbey on 29 march 2016 and a 34-year-old woman , who was a passenger in the car , died in hospital from her injuries a few days later .
another passenger in the car was injured .
anthony cheshire , who is 62 and from reynards cop in sutton hill , was charged with causing death by dangerous driving and causing serious injury by dangerous driving .

a 32-year-old woman from south east london faces the same charges and is also charged with causing death by careless driving while with a proportion of a specified controlled drug above the specified limit .
both are due to appear at chelmsford magistrates ' court on 12 april .

documents.title: three things you wanted to know
text: three things you wanted to know

documents.title: watch : prince andrew opens shropshire sweet factory
text: prince andrew has been paying a quick visit to the county today , to officially open a family-owned nougat company in shrewsbury .
his family sampled some of the confectionery at sandringham , at christmas .
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: your photos : flowers starting to bloom around shropshire
text: we 're really started to notice the photos of flowers flooding in this week - a sign that spring is finally here perhaps .
these were taken by bbc weather watchers in oakengates and newport .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: shire horses : what makes a champion ?
text: chris malkin , from market drayton , is the man to impress this weekend .
he 's a judge at the shire horse society national show in stafford .
about 250 horses from across europe have entered the event , with the highlight the king george v cup awarded on saturday .
author: John Bray
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: telford scout hut dealt a double blow by burglars and fly-tippers
text: burglars struck at a scout hut , stealing thousands of pounds of goods - and were followed by fly-tippers who dumped a trailer load of tyres .
author: Telford Journal

documents.title: watch : video game magazine artists revisit some classics
text: this 'll take you back roger kean and oliver frey were the men behind two really influential computer magazines from the days of the zx spectrum and the commodore 64 .
they 've now seen a blue plaque installed on the offices they used to work out of .
and they still own some of the original artwork from the magazines .

documents.title: on midlands today from 13:30 : crowds turn out for shire horses event
text: on midlands today this lunchtime , i 'll be live from what 's been called the largest shire horse competition in the world .
crowds will see 250 horses paraded over the next three days .
i 'll give you a taste of the event so far .
on bbc one from 13:30 .
author: Ben Godfrey
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: gust of wind turns bonfire into six-acre blaze
text: a gust of wind turned a small , controlled bonfire into a six-acre blaze on shropshire wildlife trust land .
author: South Shropshire Journal

documents.title: video offers help to firefighters with dyslexia
text: shropshire fire and rescue service has made a film about dyslexia , offering support for those who have it and assessments for those who think they might have it .
it says more than 70 of its 500 employees in the county have received help over the past nine years and that the ratio of employees with dyslexia is relatively high for a public sector organisation .
the fire service says staff with dyslexia are given extra time for exams and help when applying for promotion .

documents.title: football : afc telford united to resume selling shares
text: afc telford united expect to put shares back on sale by the end of next week .
and potential investors will now be able to purchase more than 20 % of the shares after a motion was passed to scrap the upper limit .
the club said 32 % of the shares were bought when they went on sale last year , with 139 supporters taking up the offer .
but two potential investors were put off , because of the limit on the maximum number of shares they could own .
author: Nick Southall
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: football : shrewsbury keep joins slough on loan
text: shrewsbury town goalkeeper shaun rowley has joined slough on loan .
he 's been drafted in to provide cover for goalie mark scott who fractured his neck playing for slough last weekend .
author: Nick Southall
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: council at high court to complain about funding
text: shropshire council and three other authorities have been at the high court , arguing a `` massive funding deficit '' had put local councils at risk of breaching legal duties they owe to vulnerable people who could be deprived of their liberty .
it includes those with dementia and learning difficulties .
the four councils , shropshire , nottinghamshire , liverpool and richmond , claim the government 's failure to provide adequate funding has created `` a national crisis '' for local authorities .
the local government association has said at least an extra £ 172m a year is needed nationwide .

documents.title: events held to support victims of strokes and their carers
text: events have been held this week at church stretton 's health and wellbeing centre to support people who 've had a stroke and those who care for them .
the stroke support group has also been offering advice - to help recognise the signs and symptoms .
if someone has a stroke , the thing to do is not you take them to the hospital , you must ring 999 , because as soon as the ambulance crew get there they can start the treatment .
it is so important the sooner , the better . ''
author: Genevieve Tudor
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: football : shrewsbury look to improve on vale park record
text: shrewsbury town have only won three times at vale park in the last 40 years and travel there tonight , knowing defeat could drag them right back into the relegation battle .
shrewsbury currently have a five-point cushion between themselves and port vale , who are in 21st place .
port vale have so far only won one game in 2017 , but that was against another team in the relegation-scrap - swindon town .
author: Nick Southall
Journalist

documents.title: councils 'risk failing the vulnerable '
text: councils 'risk failing the vulnerable '

documents.title: national express under fire over price of tickets
text: the coach company national express is coming under fire , for discrepancies in the cost of tickets in mid-wales .
some passengers in newtown and welshpool have had to fork out £ 80 for a return trip to london , when others , getting on the same service , back in aberystwyth , were paying only £ 35 .

national express says its prices are set according to demand and although it has since reduced its `` lowest available fare '' from newtown to london to match the price from aberystwyth , it is n't cutting fares from welshpool .
author: Andrew Hewkin
Newsreader, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: 'influential ' early computer games magazine honoured
text: a blue plaque has been put up in ludlow , to indicate the location of an influential magazine company .
the building on king street , was home to the offices of newsfield , which published some of the first computer game reviews .
it was co-owned by the illustrator oliver frey who says he never expected it to become so big .
we did n't realise quite the effect we were going to have with these reviews .
but the software houses noticed wh smith reacting to the magazine and they wanted a sort of list of what forthcoming games , they ought to stock . ''
author: Les Walton
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: tennis : bridgnorth coach selected to captain england
text: a shropshire woman 's been chosen to captain the england over-35s ladies tennis team at the four nations championships in glasgow , next month .
holly mowling , who lives in broseley , is a coach at the bridgnorth club - and has won four national titles within the last 12 months on the itf over-35s circuit .
she is now ranked number one for her age group in great britain and 13th in the world .
author: Stuart Dunn
Shrewsbury Town commentator, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: football : port vale players urged to embrace 'pressure game ' against shrewsbury
text: the port vale boss michael brown says his players need to embrace the bigger crowd expected at today 's game against shrewsbury town .
the vale start the game in the bottom four and five points behind their opponents .
radio stoke will have live match commentary on the match with build-up from 19:00 .
i think as a young player , big crowd on friday , whether it be a shot , a chance , a tackle - just be noticed on that pitch .
they 're the great games , pressure games . ''
author: Lee Blakeman
Port Vale commentator, BBC Radio Stoke

documents.title: woman 's death being treated as unexplained
text: the police are treating as unexplained the death of a woman in her 50s , whose body was found in the river severn , on wednesday afternoon .
the discovery was made near the half moon pub , in jackfield .
her identity has n't been disclosed .
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: police renew appeal to find missing man a year on
text: police have issued a new appeal for information to try and find a shrewsbury man who 's been missing for a year .
russell blent , 36 , was last seen in the meole brace area and west mercia police confirmed that his disappearance was being treated as `` sus in august last year .
in the days before he disappeared he was seen in bridgnorth , on public transport and on otley road .
he 's white , 6ft 1 '' has a heavy build and short dark hair .
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: port vale v shrewbury in crunch match
text: shrewsbury are in action tonight against fellow league one strugglers , port vale .
town are currently five points above them , and manager paul hurst admits it 's an important game , with both sides needing the points .
i 'm not putting masses of pressure on my players .
if we lose can we stay up still ?
course we can .
you know again the truth of it is , it is a big game .
there 's no getting away from that .
but i do n't feel that i need to build it up for anything that it is n't . ''
author: Mark Elliott
Reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: volunteer hopes to return to role as community first responder
text: a volunteer ambulance service worker from st martins , near oswestry , who was dismissed after an issue about paperwork , is hoping she 'll be allowed to return to her role as a community first responder .
effie cadwallader says when ambulance crews would n't take a patient 's report-forms with them , she shredded them to keep them secure .
the ambulance service said she 'd broken the data protection act .
`` patient report forms describe the treatment received by a patient and as such could be requested by a coroner or other court , '' a spokesperson said .
`` mrs cadwallader had previously been reminded of the procedures to be followed for any documentation that may remain with a community first responder .
`` as such the trust was left with no option but to take the deeply regrettable decision to terminate her agreement . ''
it 's not just me that has this problem , so the system needs to be adjusted so that it does n't happen again .
i 'd like to be re-instated as a cfr , because i think i 'm a good cfr and i know that i 'm valued here in the community . ''
author: Clare Ashford
Presenter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: video : will you need your brolly today ?
text: after a dry start , with some bright spells , a cloudy day with showers possible this afternoon and highs of 9c ( 48f ) .
you can find a detailed weather report for your area here .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: good morning - welcome to our live updates for the day
text: welcome to live updates from bbc shropshire on friday morning .
we 'll be bringing you all the news , sport , travel and weather as it happens .
if you 'd like to get in touch you can .
email , .
tweet us on @ twitterid .
or message via .
facebook .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from tomorrow , but keep an eye out here for more updates this evening and into the morning .

documents.title: woman 's body pulled from river severn in jackfield
text: a woman 's body 's been pulled out of the river severn in jackfield ,
she is believed to have been in her 50s - police are treating her death as unexplained .
her body was recovered near the half moon pub at about 12:30 yesterday , officers said , after a call from a member of the public .

documents.title: on midlands today from 18:30 : multimillion-pound plan to cut train overcrowding
text: on midlands today this evening - a multimillion-pound plan to combat overcrowding on trains in the west midlands has gained government backing .
the midlands rail hub will provide much needed extra capacity on the rail network over the next decade .
on bbc one from 18:30 we 'll be looking at whether is can deliver and what the benefits will be to you .
author: BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: football : hurst tips tyler roberts for bigger things
text: the shrewsbury town manager paul hurst is tipping tyler roberts to one day play in the premier league .
the 18-year-old striker has scored four goals since joining on loan from west bromwich albion in january .
hurst said roberts was developing his game `` every day '' and that he could already see the improvement since his previous loan spell at oxford .
author: Nick Southall
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: ice rink to close for refurbishment
text: the ice rink in telford will be closing for a fortnight of refurbishment work next month .
telford and wrekin council says the ice pad requires regular upkeep and the ice hockey markings will need repainting .
the rink is due to close on monday 24 april and reopen on monday 8 may .

documents.title: weather : rain overnight and into tomorrow
text: we 're going to have some rain moving in from the north overnight and there could be some showers tomorrow too .
check out the latest forecast for your area .
author: Shefali Oza
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: former teacher dies after fall in spain
text: a former oswestry school teacher and well known amateur rugby player has died after falling off a cliff in spain last month .
nigel keighley 's son , dave , wrote on oswestry rugby club 's facebook page to say his father had been out walking with his wife and the fall had been a `` freak accident '' .
he said he had been in a coma and passed away last tuesday .

the chairman of oswestry rugby club , don howell said mr keighley was a founder member of the club and said he was `` a fantastic player , captain , coach and vice president and my hero , he will be sadly missed by all '' .

documents.title: delays to severn valley railway 's bridgnorth project
text: work to rebuild part of the severn valley railway 's bridgnorth station has been held up , because the foundations are n't ready yet .
the railway says it was n't possible to pour in the concrete during january , because it was too cold , and this has had a knock-on effect on other work .
the foundations should have been complete by the end of january , but it says they will take another five weeks and the brickwork will have to wait until the foundations are finished .

but the railway said a lot of progress was still being made and that the delay had allowed them to carry out more planning and to get some of the fittings needed to decorate the station house , bar and toilet block , once they are complete .
by working hard behind the scenes , we are looking to catch up some of the time lost on the foundation stage during the next phase . ''

documents.title: apprentice event held in telford
text: more than 70 businesses and organisations have gathered at the international centre in telford today to showcase the apprenticeships they have on offer .
they include businesses such as stadco , capgemini , wrekin housing trust , fbc manby bowdler solicitors and gkn .

pupils in years 10 , 11 , 12 and 13 were invited to the event , to help them make their career decisions , but it has also been open to older people , because there is no longer an upper age limit for apprenticeships .
telford and wrekn council says about 2,000 have attended so far .
author: Ian Perry
BBC Radio Shropshire

documents.title: your photos : birds flying over oswestry field
text: we 've not seen the blue skies we saw in the photos from the bbc weather watchers yesterday , but there have been plenty of interesting nonetheless .
this one was taken in a field near oswestry earlier .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: house fire in cressage
text: crews from much wenlock and shrewsbury have put out a house fire in cressage .
they spent an hour at the detached home on cherry arbor , which they say was heavily smoke-logged .
the ambulance service says it was not called .

documents.title: dismay after plans to install underwater turbine are cancelled
text: news that plans to install an underwater turbine at shrewsbury 's weir have been cancelled has been met with dismay by council chiefs .
author: Shrewsbury Chronicle

documents.title: shropshire schools investigate climate change and whether guinea pigs should be on the menu
text: all sorts of subjects are being covered by the young journalists taking part in bbc school report in shropshire .
children at church stretton school quizzed the ludlow mp .
and government minister philip dunne about climate change and asked what could be done to help bees .
the pupils at meole brace school in shrewsbury have been reporting on a girl with thyroid cancer and asking whether it is right to eat guinea pigs .
author: BBC School Report

documents.title: emotional flight for mum of murdered teen
text: emotional flight for mum of murdered teen

documents.title: watch : lynnette williams flies in the plane georgia helped to build
text: following the murder of the wellington teenager georgia williams , a trust was set up in her name - to give young people the chance to follow their dreams .
now the georgia williams trust is able to give them the opportunity to fly in a plane which georgia herself helped to build .
her mother , lynnette , was one of the first to go up in it .
author: BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: oswestry teacher dies after fall from cliff in spain
text: a popular teacher from oswestry has died after falling from a cliff while on holiday in spain .
author: Oswestry and Borders Chronicle

documents.title: missing cup to return at this summer 's newport show
text: a trophy which has been missing for 113 years will be put to use again at this summer 's newport show .
the 40oz peplow challenge cup , which was valued at around £ 600 , was spotted for sale on an episode of the bbc 's flog it !
programme , which was re-broadcast last year and after some detective work , the organisers of the show were eventually able to track down its owner .
the show organisers say they did n't even know it existed before they saw it on the telly , because their records do n't go back as far as 1904 .
it will probably be presented to the winner of a horse-competition at the event on 8 july .

documents.title: production of wuthering heights filmed in shropshire
text: a small film production company called three hedghogs production is filming wuthering heights at the acton scott working farm museum .
here , from left to right , is richard d roberts , who plays edgar , sha'ori morris , who plays cathy and paul eryk atlas , who plays heathcliffe .

documents.title: horse-racing : shropshire horse finishes fourth
text: there was no cheltenham win for the shropshire-owned politologue today .
he finished fourth in his race earlier .
the race was won by the favourite , yorkhill , ridden by ruby walsh .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: football : hughes expected to return for bradford game
text: telford expect lee hughes to be available for saturday 's game against bradford park avenue .
the striker has missed the last few weeks with a groin strain .
assistant manager larry chambers is confident he 'll be included in the match day squad .
author: Nick Southall
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: piano gold coin stash 'life-changing sum '
text: piano gold coin stash 'life-changing sum '

documents.title: on midlands today from 13:30 : rail hub aims to cut overcrowding
text: on midlands today this lunchtime we 'll have news of a multimillion-pound plan to prevent overcrowding on trains in the west midlands .
the midlands rail hub includes a variety of measures , aimed at providing much needed additional capacity over the next decade .
we 'll have more and if officials can deliver on their promises from 13:30 on bbc one .
author: BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: your photos : cloudy skies around shropshire
text: the clouds over shropshire have been allowing the bbc weather watchers to take some dramatic photos of the skies around the county .
these were taken this morning in hopton heath ( top ) and kinnersley ( below ) .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: man tied up and robbed in high ercall was local councillor
text: the leader of telford & wrekin council says he 's shocked at the attack on a borough councillor working in high ercall .
stephen bentley was tied up and threatened with baseball bats while working at an outreach post office in the village hall yesterday .
the robbers drove off in the tory councillor 's silver jaguar .
council leader shaun davies says he is `` relieved he was n't seriously injured '' .
author: Tim Page
News Editor, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: your questions : why do people refer to 'south shropshire ' , but not 'east or west shropshire ' ?
text: here 's an interesting question asked by natasha leigh-willetts : `` why is south shropshire referred as such ?
you do n't hear east shropshire or west shropshire . ''
we think the answer could have something to do with the old south shropshire district council , which was created in the mid-1970s and then absorbed into shropshire council in 2009 .
further back in history there was once a south shropshire parliamentary constituency .
similarly , north shropshire is often referred to because there was a north shropshire district council before 2009 and there is still a north shropshire constituency .
east and west shropshire have n't had the same shared political history .
another theory is that maybe east shropshire is more diverse , with towns like telford , bridgnorth and newport sharing less in common that the largely rural south shropshire .
if you have questions you 'd like us to investigate , we 'd love to hear them .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: church stretton homes without water after burst water main
text: a burst water pipe has left people in church stretton with no water .
author: South Shropshire Journal

documents.title: council standing firm over muxton plans
text: councillors in telford say they wo n't back down in refusing plans for 150 new houses in muxton .
they were discussed at last night 's planning committee , ahead of an appeal being heard in june .
the council says the development 's unsuitable for the rural area .

documents.title: in telford lights at night
text: have you seen these stunning images of telford 's southwater development and of the m54 ?
they were both taken by the bbc 's john bray last night .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: what is treasure ?
text: according to the treasure act 1996 , treasure is defined as any object which is at least 300 years old when found and :

documents.title: hydro-electric scheme dropped
text: the people behind plans to generate electricity from the river severn in shrewsbury are blaming subsidy cuts for the cancellation of the scheme .
shrewsbury hydro were hoping to be up and running by march 2018 .
but delays in leasing the land they need - near the town 's weir - means that wo n't happen , so the guaranteed-price they would get for electricity would have dropped by more than half .

documents.title: john hales going for win at cheltenham
text: it 's day three of the cheltenham festival and shropshire owner john hales ' horse - politologue - is being tipped as a potential winner of the jlt novices ' chase 2m 4f .
the horse is regarded as champion trainer paul nicholls ' best chance of a winner at this year 's festival .
the race is first up today at 13:30 .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: man charged with attempted murder following bomere heath stabbing
text: a man 's been charged with two counts of attempted murder in connection with a stabbing in bomere heath last week .
wayne williams , who 's 54 , is appearing at telford magistrates ' court this morning .
three people were injured at a house on sefton way on wednesday 8 march .
author: Tim Page
News Editor, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: first flight in plane georgia williams helped to build
text: the mother of murdered shropshire teenager georgia williams has taken an emotional first flight in a plane her late daughter helped to build at ercall wood school .
georgia was 17 when she was murdered in a sexually motivated attack by jamie reynolds at his home in wellington .
lynnette williams took to the skies over halfpenny green airport in the aircraft which will now be used for the benefit of other young people .
author: BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: weather watchers : a misty start for shropshire
text: compared with yesterday , the weather is a bit dull .
the misty start certainly looks dramatic though .
thanks to weather watcher hopton karen for this view of hopton heath .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: treasure inquest into hoard of gold found in piano
text: there 's a treasure inquest in shrewsbury today , to determine what should happen to a quantity of gold found hidden inside a piano .
it was discovered in south west shropshire last year and could be declared the property of the crown if its owner or their heirs ca n't be traced .
experts think the valuables might have been `` deliberately hidden '' in the piano more than 100 years ago .
the current owners had recently been given the instrument and reported the find to ludlow museum resource centre .

documents.title: video : where 's the sunshine gone ?
text: not as nice as yesterday , with some fog around first thing , then a cloudy day with the potential for drizzle later on with highs of 11c ( 52f ) .
you can find a full forecast for your area on the bbc weather site .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: good morning from bbc shropshire
text: i 'm in the newsroom taking a look at the latest news , sport , travel and weather .
if you spot a story we should be mentioning you can get in touch via email , facebook or twitter .
author: Carlie Swain
BBC Local Live

documents.title: four-hour waits up 300 % in some hospitals
text: four-hour waits up 300 % in some hospitals
author: Laurence Cawley
BBC News

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 tomorrow , but keep an eye out here for more updates this evening and into the morning .

documents.title: boy taken to hospital after being hit by car in telford
text: an 11-year-old boy has been taken to hospital after being hit by a car in telford .
author: Telford Journal

documents.title: why a marriage led to a change in the law of fraternisation
text: a historian is suggesting that a shropshire marriage led to a change in the law of fraternisation .
paul minton has been researching the story of a german prisoner of war , hermann ganter , and his british bride , sgt monica cann , a short-hand typist .
they met and fell in love while he was at a detention camp in donnington in 1946 .
their marriage , at wellington register office , is believed to have led to a change in the laws of fraternisation .
author: Genevieve Tudor
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: councils show lack of enthusiasm for merger
text: the north shropshire mp might be keen on merging shropshire 's two unitary authorities , but the councils themselves are less enthusiastic .

the conservative leader of shropshire council , malcolm pate , said `` there are no plans whatsoever to take over telford and wrekin council '' and his counterpart shaun davies said : `` this issue has been regularly aired and rejected by both councils , precisely because we represent very different areas . ''
there will be more on this story on sunday politics midlands at 11:00 on sunday .

documents.title: watch : a clear night ahead but turning cloudy tomorrow
text: it will be a clear and settled start to the evening .
it will feel cool under clear skies , allowing areas of fog to develop through the early hours .
however , it should remain dry for most - lows of 4c ( 39f ) .
tomorrow will be much cloudier , with outbreaks of light rain expected through the afternoon .
author: Shefali Oza
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: conservative mp wants shropshire 's councils to merge
text: the mp for north shropshire , owen paterson , says merging the county 's two main councils could save £ 20m a year .
mr paterson says telford and wrekin council provides `` totally unnecessary duplication '' to the work done by shropshire council .
and he said telford and wrekin council 's opposition to plans to move emergency and women and children 's services to shrewsbury was an `` absolutely ridiculous waste of public money '' .

documents.title: 'house full of cannabis ' raided by police
text: police in shrewsbury have raided a house which they say was `` full of cannabis '' .
one person has been arrested .

documents.title: film club award for telford primary school
text: the meadows primary school in ketley has won a national award for its film club , at an event attended by stars like daniel craig , eddie redmayne and charles dance .
a group of pupils , aged between seven and 11 , got to go to the into film event at leicester square with their teachers .
the children were invited on stage to be presented with their award by actor ruth wilson , who has starred in tv shows such as the affair and luther .

documents.title: breakingman tied up and robbed by armed men in village hall
text: a 61-year-old man has been tied up , threatened with baseball bats and robbed at the village hall in high ercall .
police say two men wearing boiler suits , with scarves covering their faces , walked into the the building shortly before 11:30 .
they got away with the keys to the man 's silver jaguar .
the man was not seriously injured and managed to free himself and get to a nearby house to raise the alarm - he is said to be `` very shaken '' by the experience .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: national trust properties carry out spring clean
text: staff at national trust properties in shropshire have been carrying out a spring clean - a process that can take weeks .
simply setting the dinner table at attingham park ( below ) in the style of a 1830s ambassadorial dinner can take three days .
the organisation says polishing the wooden floors in the galleries at dudmaston hall takes four volunteers a whole week .

even the simple task of dusting needs specialist equipment - a soft pony hair brush is used on ceramics and gilded surfaces , whilst a stiffer hog 's hair brush is used for wooden furniture or plasterwork .
and brushes are used with a small vacuum cleaner so that dust is removed , not just displaced . ''

documents.title: retail park expansion 'could threaten shrewsbury 's riverside mall redevelopment '
text: the expansion of meole brace retail park could threaten the redevelopment of shrewsbury 's riverside mall , according to the centre 's owners .
author: Shrewsbury Chronicle

documents.title: fire at electricity substation thought to have caused power cuts
text: a fire at an electricity substation in telford is thought to have left 2,000 homes without power this afternoon .
firefighters were called to the university of wolverhampton 's campus in priorslee just before midday and reported hearing pops and bangs and smoke billowing out .
after they put out the flames , engineers from western power were able to fix the fault .

documents.title: your photos : more of blue skies from around the county
text: the bbc weather watchers have been sharing some great photos of blue skies around shropshire .
these ones were taken in ellesmere ( top ) and hopton heath ( below ) .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: aldi coming to telford 's new northern quarter development
text: discount supermarket aldi is coming to telford as part of the £ 15m redevelopment of the northern quarter , formerly the asda supermarket at telford shopping centre .
author: Telford Journal

documents.title: landlords to buy licences before renting properties
text: landlords in some parts of telford could have to pay for a licence before renting their homes , under plans being considered by the local authority .
telford and wrekin said the scheme , expected to cost £ 610 per landlord , was designed to encourage them to vet tenants better and prevent problems such as fly-tipping and anti-social behaviour .
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: man arrested following bomere heath stabbing
text: a 54-year-old man has been arrested on sus of two counts of attempted murder following a stabbing incident at a house in bomere heath last week .
police were called to a bungalow on sefton drive last tuesday morning where a woman had been stabbed in the chest .
a man was also suffering from stab wounds and a second woman had a head injury - all three were taken to hospital with non-life threatening injuries .
author: Faith Page
Reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: planning inspector blocks bicton homes plan
text: a housing developer has lost its fight to build new homes near shrewsbury .
a planning inspector upheld shropshire council 's decision not to allow the development off bicton lane in bicton .
the report says the proposal , originally for 25 then reduced to 15 homes , would have `` serious and harmful '' impact on the environment .

documents.title: on midlands today from 13:30 : regeneration plans set to create jobs
text: this lunchtime on midlands today - how thousands of jobs could be created in part of the region through a regeneration plan .
plus we 'll have the latest unemployment figures and news of a pension protest by car workers in the midlands .
those stories along with your lunchtime weather forecast .
on bbc one from 13:30 .
author: Giles Latcham
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: football : telford enjoy long-awaited victory over county rivals
text: afc telford united 's 2-0 victory in the shropshire senior cup last night was only their third since they reformed and their first since 2014 - when shrewsbury did n't enter a team .
their last win over shrewsbury town in the tournament was in 2009 , when they won on penalties .
for both afc telford united and shrewsbury town , last night 's match was a chance to lift some silverware in what has been a difficult season for both clubs .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: market drayton primary school parking problems tackled with cones
text: police have unveiled their latest measure to tackle persistent parking problems outside primary schools .
author: Market Drayton Advertiser

documents.title: your photos : beautiful sunshine in shropshire
text: it looks like we 're in for another fine spring day in shropshire and we 've had some great photos of the sun from the bbc weather watchers , such as this one taken in newport .
we really like this one too - the way the cloud is broken up and illuminated by the sun , it looks like the sky is filled with ufos .
or are they fish ?
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: plans for footpath round former quarry abandoned
text: plans for a footpath around a former quarrying area in condover have been dropped .
it was part of a plan to restore part of gonsal quarry to nature .
the developer 's now agreed to give an area of woodland and £ 10,000 to the parish council instead .
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: football : shrewsbury pleased with cup final experience
text: shrewsbury town 's chris doig said that while last night 's defeat in the shropshire senior cup final `` was n't the result we wanted '' it was a `` fantastic experience '' for some of their younger footballers .
they fielded a mix of youth team players and members of the first team squad in the match and doig said it was `` a good chance to see youth team play in a much more physical environment '' .
afc telford united played a near-full strength side in the match and were rewarded with a 2-0 win .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: council in court to fight for more funds for adult social care
text: shropshire council 's going to court today , to fight for more money for adult social care .
it 's one of four authorities who say the government 's not properly funding assessments of people with learning disabilities or dementia .
the council says there 's been a big increase in the number of people being assessed since a supreme court judgement led to many more people needing tests .
it says the number has gone up from 160 to 1400 in the two years following the judgement and `` without adequate funding '' it says there 's `` no alternative '' but to go to the high court .

documents.title: unemployment up 9,000 in west midlands in latest figures
text: unemployment in the west midlands rose by 9,000 to 160,000 in the three months to january , official figures show .
they show the region saw the joint-largest jobless increase compared with the rest of the country - five other areas also saw rises .
it means the current unemployment rate in the west midlands is 5.6 % , the office for national statistics said .
that compares with the uk unemployment rate falling to 4.7 % , its lowest rate in 41 years in the three months to january .
author: Allen Cook
BBC Local Live

documents.title: whitchurch herald front page : town medic to take part in 10k run
text: no-one can accuse whitchurch 's doctors of not practising what they preach .
author: Whitchurch Herald

documents.title: football : afc telford utd win cup for only third time since reforming
text: afc telford united won the shropshire senior cup last night , beating shrewsbury town 2-0 .
elliott hodge scored from a penalty 30 seconds into the second half , after being brought down by the shrewsbury keeper .
and connor mccarthy marked his return to the side with a late close-range header that was on target .
assistant manager larry chambers called the game `` a great distraction from the league '' , and said telford deserved the win .
it means a lot to the fans and we said to the lads before the game , it 's a cup final .
we tried to reiterate how much it means to everybody in telford , the rivalry between shrewsbury and telford and in fairness the lads have gone out and put a good performance in . ''
author: Nick Southall
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: cure for baldness more likely , than one for malaria
text: students at shrewsbury sixth form college will be discussing why society is more likely to invest research funds into finding a cure for baldness than getting rid of malaria .
they 're talking to simon trace , the former head of practical action - a charity that uses technology to change the lives of the two billion people around the world who live in poverty .
author: Jim Hawkins Show

documents.title: start of 'close season ' for coarse fishing
text: the environment agency says its enforcement teams will rigorously police a ban on coarse fishing that comes into force from today .
the three-month break gives shoals of fish such as barbel and chub and chance to breed , for numbers to replenish .
beautiful & quiet on the # severn as today is the 1st day of the coarse fish # closeseason listen to @ twitterid 8:15 why we have a season
thanks so much for coming in chris , especially the early morning start !
no salmon anglers ?
just shows how c/r has ruined it
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: ambulance service confirms twitter hack
text: west midlands ambulance service has confirmed its twitter account was hacked this morning .
the tweet which went up at around 07:00 carried text supporting the turkish president recep tayyip erdogan who is in a feud with germany and the netherlands .
the post was deleted shortly afterwards .
the ambulance service says it 's now removed the post and changed its passwords and security settings .

other twitter accounts also appeared to have been hacked overnight including the bbc north america account which tweeted at : `` hi everyone - we temporarily lost control of this account , but normal service has resumed .
thanks . ''
hi everyone - we temporarily lost control of this account , but normal service has resumed .
thanks .
that would explain this
@ twitterid @ twitterid having temporarily lost control of the country will normal service be resumed there too # trump
@ twitterid has been hacked too - you got same password or something ? ? ! !
@ twitterid
terrible-glad you recovered .
uh k ?
author: Phil Bowers
Journalist, BBC Radio Stoke

documents.title: telford landlords face a £ 610 licence bill
text: private landlords on some telford housing estates could be forced to license their properties on some estates in a bid to combat issues such as fly-tipping and anti-social behaviour .
if councillors approve the scheme , already used in some other parts of the country , a five-year licence would cost £ 610 per landlord .
i think it is about the landlords knowing who 's living in their properties , so we 'll be asking them to undertake some tenant checks .

i think it 's right and proper to ask landlords to visit their properties regularly , to take a look , to make sure that tenants living in their properties are playing their bit in the community and keeping it a nice , safe place to live . ''
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: watch : a dry and bright day ahead
text: skies will be partly cloudy today with some sunny spells at times .
it will stay dry through the day and it will feel mild in the sunshine and light winds - highs of 16c ( 61f ) .
author: Sara Blizzard
BBC Weather

documents.title: good morning from bbc shropshire
text: i 'm here with all your news , sport , travel and weather updates this morning .
do get in touch if you have a story or you 'd like to share .
you can email , tweet or get in touch via our facebook page .
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: cooper & davies - 'untitled '
text: cooper & davies - 'untitled '

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 tomorrow , but keep an eye out here for more updates this evening and into the morning .

documents.title: coming up on midlands today
text: more on the staffordshire farmer who has lost most of his herd of dairy cattle after they tested positive fore bovine tb .
we also take a look at the report into 'squalid ' conditions at hmp and yoi swinfen hall and find out why shopshire council is taking the government to the high court .
more on these stories on bbc one at 18.30
author: Mary Rhodes
Presenter, BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: woman remains in hospital after brookside attack
text: a 21-year-old woman is still being treated in hospital for `` serious injuries '' after she was attacked at a house in telford on sunday .
west mercia police says she was in the house in brookside with a 28-year-old man when someone broke in and attacked them .
the man suffered a broken wrist and facial injuries and has been released from hospital .

documents.title: ludlow debutant helps firefighters torch police rugby side
text: while england were beating scotland at the weekend , ludlow firefighter george jacks was involved in a nail-biting rugby match against the english police team .
he was playing for the uk fire service team which came back from 26-3 down to win the game at bromsgrove rugby club 34-33 .
the 26-year-old , who works for a local nut company during the week , was playing his first game for the uk side , which is made up of players from england and wales .

documents.title: football : shrewsbury look to continue dominance in cup
text: shrewsbury town are easily the most successful team in the shropshire senior cup 's history with over 60 wins in total and six victories in the last ten tournaments .
afc telford united last won the cup in 2014 when shrewsbury pulled out of the competition and they also had a win over shrewsbury on penalties in 2009 .
the new saints entered sides a couple of times in the last decade and won the tournament in 2012 , but they have n't been involved for the past two seasons .
and going back further in history , teams to win the tournament just once include wolverhampton wanderers , shrewsbury engineers and bridgnorth town .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: locomotives arrive on the back of a lorry
text: the severn valley railway is celebrating its spring steam gala this weekend and a number of visiting locomotives have been arriving on the back of lorries this week .
earlier this afternoon this br standard 9f was delivered to its bridgnorth station by the great central railway .
it has been described by the severn valley railway as `` one of the most powerful steam locomotives in britain '' and it 's one of three making a guest appearance .

documents.title: volunteers wanted to help settle council disputes
text: volunteers are wanted to help settle disputes involving shropshire councillors .
the authority says it is looking to appoint at least two of these `` independent persons '' to get involved when there are allegations its code of conduct has been breached .
people working for the council , the family of councillors and people involved with political parties are barred from applying , but no previous experience of this sort of thing is necessary .

documents.title: identity of body found in search for missing shropshire man to be confirmed
text: the identity of a body found in bridgnorth is not likely to be revealed until later this week .
author: Bridgnorth Journal

documents.title: politics of marriage and divorce
text: politics of marriage and divorce
author: Patrick Burns
Political editor, Midlands

documents.title: sixties classic used to teach pi to students
text: the animals classic `` house of the rising sun '' is being used to teach pi to students at north shropshire college .
maths teachers there say they wanted to have a bit of fun , because today is `` national pi day '' and they 've come up with the first two verses of the song .
students are now being challenged to complete it - as maths teacher wayne young explained to us .
author: Mark Elliott
Reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: rogue gardener who pressured elderly victims is jailed
text: a rogue gardener who pressured elderly victims into paying hundreds of pounds for work has been jailed for 21 months .
author: Shrewsbury Chronicle

documents.title: your photos : spring photos from around the county
text: spring definitely seems to be in the air this week and we 've been seeing some stunning photos from the bbc weather watchers .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: apologies after huge turnout for cancer screening event
text: the organisers of a prostate cancer screening evening in madeley , shropshire , have had to apologise after they ran out of testing kits - because of the huge turnout .
the event at jubilee house attracted 450 men and the ironbridge lions and ironbridge rotary clubs said they had not realised house successful it would be .
the rotary groups say they ordered 420 testing kits , but they did n't want to buy too many , because they cost £ 15 each .
they will be holding two more testing events in the coming months .
we can only apologise for having to turn away the last few men who came and hope that they will understand the situation was beyond our control .
this is the first time we have staged such an event and we did n't in a million years envisage that the 420 kits we had ordered would be insufficient . ''

documents.title: shropshire mp urges scotland to remain in uk
text: north shropshire mp owen paterson says the scots would be better of remaining part of the uk , saying brexit offers a `` a wonderful opportunity for scotland '' .
he also told bbc radio four that spain might block scotland from joining the eu as an independent nation , for fear it might give a boost to those who want independence for catalonia .
mr paterson said the snp had other domestic issues it should be concentrating on , instead of demanding a second independence referendum .
surely far better is to see how brexit pans out and instead of all this doom mongering to see the tremedous opportunities that brexit will bring to thousands of people across scotland ? ''

documents.title: shrewsbury beer garden saved by planning inspector
text: a planning inspector has rejected plans to build four homes on the site of a shrewsbury beer garden , explaining it would be an unacceptable loss of local facilities .
a developer wanted to build on the grounds of the inn on the green on the radbrook green estate and had appealed to the inspector after shropshire council turned it down .
the inspector concluded the pub was a `` cherished facility at the heart of the local community '' and that the `` spacious beer garden adds to the attraction of the public house '' .

she also dismissed proposals to replace it with a smaller beer garden , saying `` it is difficult to see how this area would provide an attractive area for patrons to sit '' and that it would n't be big enough for children to play in .
it would seem to me that the existing beer garden contributes to the vitality of the inn on the green .
the replacement offer would be significantly less attractive or flexible for use than the existing provision . ''

documents.title: oswestry advertiser : call for first responder to get her job back
text: a life-saving volunteer first responder has been sacked because she shredded two pieces of paper instead of taking it on a 50-mile round trip to shrewsbury .
author: Oswestry & Border Counties Advertizer

documents.title: coming up on midlands today
text: a staffordshire farmer loses his cattle herd after an outbreak of bovine tb and a warning over internet scams .
all this and more on midlands today , bbc one at 13.30 .
author: Amy Cole
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: football : shrewsbury to play some youth players in cup final
text: paul hurst says he wants to use tonight 's shropshire senior cup final as the chance to give some players more playing time and to introduce some youth team players .
he said there are places up for grabs in his league side and tonight will be an opportunity for several players to show what they can do .
but hurst also says that he is focused on winning the final , which they have won for the past two seasons .
some players will play from the first team squad .
some lads have n't had any game time for quite a while .
bit of match practice .
but it will be a mixed team with some of the youth team as well . ''
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: fresh fight starts to save historic clun bridge
text: calls have been renewed for something to be done about huge articulated lorries crossing an historic bridge after it was damaged yet again .
author: South Shropshire Journal

documents.title: primary school film club up for award in london
text: members of the film club at the the meadows primary school in ketley will be walking the red carpet in leicester square today .
the club has been nominated for a film club of the year award in the 2017 into film awards .

documents.title: ice hockey : focus on playoffs for tigers
text: with just one game remaining in the regular season and the league title already in the bag , telford tigers say they are now looking ahead to the playoffs .

the tournament starts on 22 march , with the top eight teams in the english premier league divided into two groups of four and the top two teams from those two groups advancing to the finals in coventry on 8 and 9 april .
the tigers know that eighth-placed sheffield steeldogs will be in their group and that second-placed milton keynes lightning wo n't , but the rest of the line-up is still to be decided .
you never want to stop at just one trophy and you want win as many as possible .
everyone in the changing room will be geared up and ready to go . ''
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: watch : how the weather nags at the races
text: when the going gets tough , the tough get checking the weather forecast , or at least those who want to a winner at the races do .
as cheltenham festival 2017 gets under way , bbc weather 's rebecca wood explains about having a flutter in the wind and more .
author: Rebecca Wood
BBC Weather

documents.title: football : shrewsbury town v afc telford united
text: shrewsbury town and afc telford united are competing for bragging rights tonight in the shropshire senior cup final at the greenhous meadow .
shrewsbury beat telford on penalties in last year 's final .
ssc : town set to take on @ twitterid in the shropshire senior cup final on tuesday 14th march at 7:30pm # salop >
@ twitterid going ?

documents.title: shropshire in top ten of museum league table
text: shropshire has one of the highest number of registered museums for any local authority area in the country , according to an .
interactive map which went online this morning .
it was created by the charity .
nesta which used data from the arts council to show which parts of country had the best access to museums .
the shropshire council area is seventh on the list , behind local authority areas like cornwall , westminster and wiltshire , but ahead of some big cities like leeds , york and birmingham .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: shrewsbury quarry swimming pool plan response is expected
text: shrewsbury town council hopes to have feedback on its plans for the future of the town 's swimming baths from shropshire council by next week .
author: Shrewsbury Chronicle

documents.title: weather watchers : a bright start replaced by grey cloud
text: it was looking like another bright spring morning , and we had a couple of photos of bright blue skies shared by the bbc weather watchers , like this one from gordon in oakengates .
but it 's started to cloud over now , and we are getting photos like this one taken by julie in oswestry .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: concern that most cyber crime goes unreported
text: figures show there were nearly six million fraud and cyber crime cases across the country in a year - including 4,557 in the west mercia area .
the cases - many involving online banking - were reported by .
action fraud in the year prior to september last year .
but police forces are concerned that most still go unreported - leaving many victims `` forgotten '' .

documents.title: estate left with clean-up bill of over £ 20k
text: up to three lorry-loads of waste , dumped at the enville estate just off the bridgnorth to stourbridge road , will cost thousands to clean up .
the fly-tippers were spotted on tuesday afternoon by a passer-by who was then chased away by men in balaclavas .
author: Joan Cummins
Midlands Today reporter

documents.title: dog trainer to be sentenced over lamb deaths
text: a 64-year-old dog trainer is due to be sentenced later after he admitted allowing his two dogs to kill and injure more than 50 lambs .

charles ross-robertson , from stanton lacy , ludlow , pleaded guilty at hereford crown court in january to allowing his rotweiller cross dogs to attack the sheep in a field at risbury near leominster .
he 's due to appear at worcester crown court today .
an application has been made for the dogs to be put down .

documents.title: big busk signs 100th act
text: the big busk has enlisted its 100th act for this year 's event .
it means the 2017 event next month will be the biggest one yet .
it was set up in memory of ben bebbington , a musician who was murdered in shrewsbury in 2012 and all the money raised goes to the shrewsbury ark , a centre for homeless and vulnerable people .
drum roll please yep - we 've broken through 100 acts registered for # thebigbusk 2017 .
thank you everyone !

documents.title: video : what 's the weather got in store today ?
text: after a cloudy start , a few brighter intervals are possible ; feeling mild with highs of 14c ( 57f ) .
you can find a detailed forecast for your area here .
author: Sara Blizzard
BBC Weather

documents.title: latest from bbc local live for shropshire
text: good morning .
i 'm in the bbc shropshire newsroom taking a look at the latest news , sport , travel and weather .
do you have a story or to share ?
you can email us or get in touch via facebook or twitter .
author: Carlie Swain
BBC Local Live

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 tomorrow , but keep an eye out here for more updates this evening and into the morning .

documents.title: telford road closures warning
text: a reminder if you 're travelling around telford over the next couple of weeks .
reminder-road closures will be in place at randlay int ( north bridge deck ) for 2 wks .
please use alternative routes

documents.title: facial cancer operations increase
text: the number of operations to remove facial cancer in shropshire has gone up in the last six years .
the procedure involves removing a patient 's tumour , and often reconstructing their jaw with tissue or bone from their arms or legs and it can take up to 12 hours .
sunil bhatia is a maxilofacial surgeon at the hospitals in shrewsbury and telford and he said he carried out 20 procedures last year , compared with five in 2010 .
author: Alex Seftel
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: steam machines to take part in road run through the ironbridge gorge
text: an eclectic collection of over 30 machines will take part in a challenging road run around the ironbridge gorge on saturday , 13 may when engines and drivers will be tested with steep climbs and gentle descents .
author: Shropshire Live

documents.title: on midlands today from 18:30 : mountain of waste fly-tipped on woodland
text: on midlands today this evening - more fly-tipping as around 200 tonnes of commercial rubbish has been dumped on private woodland .
fly-tippers drove lorry-loads of waste on to the enville estate on tuesday afternoon .
we 'll have the full story including the cost of clean-up from 18:30 on bbc one .
author: Nick Owen
Presenter, BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: medieval seal gives clues to original owner
text: a medieval seal found in a field near wrockwardine appears to have an interesting story to tell .
the inscription translates as `` counter-seal of roger of veiloreave - clerk '' and the shropshire finds liason officer , peter revill speculates the unusual name may have welsh origins .
mr reavill also says clerks were often clergymen at this time and the image of a priest on the seal could be a of its owner .
and he explains this type of seal would have been used for the closing of personal letters .
the fact that it is exceptionally well made in good quality silver indicates that the original owner was relatively rich .
as a cleric who could read and write roger would have been an important person who potentially wielded considerable administrative power . ''

documents.title: watch : tonight and tomorrow 's weather forecast for the west midlands
text: after a bright , sunny day today , here 's how tonight and tomorrow are shaping up .
you can also keep up-to-date with the latest forecast at the bbc weather website .
author: Alex Hamilton
BBC Weather

documents.title: your photos : sunny weather all around shropshire
text: it 's been a beautiful sunny day in shropshire today , as you can see from these photos taken by bbc weather watchers in oakengates , church stretton and hopton heath .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: police investigate after girl approached by stranger in priorslee
text: police are investigating a report of a 12-year-old girl being approached by a man in a car , who asked her if she wanted a lift home .
the girl was walking along derwent drive in priorslee at around 17:45 last thursday , close to the edge of the lake known as the flash .
she rejected the offer of a lift and walked to a nearby relative 's house .
the white mercedes e220 convertible is thought to have two men in it .

documents.title: severn valley railway share issue tops £ 1m
text: the severn valley railway is well on course to reach its target of raising £ 2.5m through a share issue after raising £ 1m in the first four months .
it passed that mark at the start of the march .
the money is going to be used to fund improvements to its station in bridgnorth and the £ 1 shares will remain on sale until the end of october .

documents.title: health bosses agree a & e plan
text: health bosses have agreed moves to reduce pressure on shropshire 's a & e units , to try to keep out people who do n't need to be seen , and get faster treatment for those who do .

it follows a `` escalation meeting '' between hospital managers and representatives from nhs england and nhs improvement which was called because of the growing pressure on a & e - 20,000 people have sought treatment since the start of the year .
they agreed aims to speed up ambulance handovers , plan better for discharging people after treatment , and improve the way patients move through the system .
but before next year , hospital bosses warn , the nhs will have to focus more effort on keeping people out of hospital .

documents.title: archery : volunteers wanted to help great britain archers
text: great britain 's paralympic archery team , based at lilleshall , is looking for volunteers to come and lend a hand .
and the job is really straightforward - they want people to pull the arrows out of the target , to save the archers having to wheel themselves back and forth .
the team topped the paralympic archery medal table in rio and is looking to repeat that success at tokyo .
one of the ways that we get ahead is that our athletes can train more than other nations .
if they can shoot 200 arrows a day .
the only thing they ca n't do is go to the target and pull the arrows out . ''

documents.title: telford gridlocked as roadworks bring town to halt during rush hour
text: roadworks have caused rush-hour gridlock on a number of routes throughout telford this morning as commuters struggle to get to work .
author: Telford Journal

documents.title: medieval seal could go on display in shrewsbury museum
text: a 600-year-old metal seal could go on display at the shrewsbury museum , after legally being declared as treasure by a coroner .
the oval metal stamp is just over an inch long , and was found near wrockwardine .
it 's engraved with the name of roger of veiloreave , thought to be a local cleric from the 13th or 14th century .
the museum now has to find the money to pay the finder and owner of the land where it was found .

documents.title: new child sex exploitation awareness campaign
text: west mercia police have launched another campaign to raise awareness of child sex exploitation .
they are calling it .
tell someone .
and are encouraging people to recognise the signs of child sexual exploitation and to tell someone if they have concerns .
the force defines child sex exploitation as a form of child abuse which involves a young person is encouraged , or forced , to take part in sexual activity in exchange for something .
it has set up a website which lists some of the warning signs for parents .

documents.title: 'get a grip people ' - anger on social media over police dog campaign
text: the latest twist in the failed campaign to help a retired police dog handler to buy the dog he was working with has sparked a fierce reaction on social media .
a crowdfunding campaign has to date raised thousands to help sergeant david evans buy police dog ivy .
now a. petition 's been launched calling for the chief constable of west mercia police to resign .
over his decision to unite ivy with a new handler .
here 's what you had to say on facebook :
get a grip people , at the end of the day it 's a working dog and was trained to do just that .
we 've seen the police documentaries on tv and you can see how much the dogs really enjoy what they 're doing and the dog will continue to do so with a new handler . ''
as long as she is happy and well looked and continuing to serve with a new handler , i see no reason for the chief constable to let her go .

wow that 's it consider the dogs feeling x how about we train these dogs yes for the police but she is n't a desk gun or paperwork she is a living animal with feelings and wishes , he offered to pay for the dog , this dog has lived every day with its family not the police . ''

documents.title: spring event to return in telford
text: there 's going to be a free spring into the park event for families in telford town park on 22 april .
it 's the second time telford and wrekin council has organised the festival , which will include activities like archery , camp fire building and traditional funfair games .
there will also be a llama show jumping and an appearance by the gruffalo to entertain the children and the event will be staged in the arena .

documents.title: on midlands today from 13:30 : seatbelt dangers and fly-tipping fines
text: this lunchtime on midlands today , we 'll hear from the mother whose 12-year-old son was n't wearing a seatbelt when he died in a car crash .
she 's now helping police in the region raise awareness of the dangers .
we 'll also look at news that one of our midlands ' councils is looking to bring in on-the-spot fines for anyone caught fly-tipping .
those stories and more from 13:30 on bbc one .
author: Amy Cole
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: large pile of rubbish dumped at enville estate
text: the managers of the enville estate , just off the bridgnorth to stourbridge road , say it will cost at least £ 10,000 to clear up a large pile of rubbish dumped on its land .
the country landowners association , which represents landowners in rural england and wales has called for more legal action to prevent fly-tipping in the region .

documents.title: council seeks firms to redevelop historic shifnal chapel site
text: shropshire council is appealing to firms to take on the redevelopment of a former shifnal chapel .
author: Bridgnorth Journal

documents.title: watch : big celebrations for telford tigers
text: the champagne was flowing at telford ice rink last night , as the tigers ice hockey team lifted the english premier league trophy .
the tigers have one regular season game left against milton keynes on sunday before the play-offs begin on 22 march .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: new rector to be licensed in may
text: the new rector of ludlow is expected to be licensed in may
it means he will be taking formal charge of an area , which includes one of the most historically important churches in shropshire , st laurence 's .
the reverend kelvin price has been acting rector of ludlow since last september .
he was ordained following a career in the army and has worked as a priest in the hereford diocese since 2010 .

documents.title: football : chorley 2-1 telford united
text: afc telford united again missed the fire-power of lee hughes at the weekend but were praised for a better performance .
hughes is currently out with a groin injury .
despite saturday 's defeat at chorley , assistant manager larry chambers says the team restored some pride after last weeks 6-0 thrashing by brackley .
i think we missed lee and i think we 've missed luke higham .
hopefully this time next week we might have those two available . ''
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: drivers find mobile 'not-spots ' via app
text: drivers find mobile 'not-spots ' via app

documents.title: to contribute to legal costs of savile victim
text: the bbc 's agreed to contribute to the legal costs of a woman from oswestry , who was one of jimmy savile 's victims .
karin ward won a libel case brought by freddie starr who she also accused in a bbc interview , but never recouped her legal costs .
the corporation says it 's pleased the matter 's been resolved .

documents.title: 'serious injuries ' at trampoline park
text: 'serious injuries ' at trampoline park

documents.title: extra social care funding welcomed by conservatives
text: plans to give another £ 6m to telford and a wrekin council , to pay for adult social care over the next three years , have been welcomed by the leader of the conservatives on telford and wrekin council .
councillor andrew eade said it would make a `` considerable difference '' when combined with the extra £ 3.6m the authority expects to collect through increased council taxes over the same period .
the leader of the ruling labour group , councillor shaun davies , said the extra adult social care money was `` welcome but not enough '' .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: football : tns increase their lead with win over second-placed bala
text: goals from adrian cieslewicz , alex darlington and jamie mullan gave the new saints a 3-2 win over second-placed bala town .
the victory means tns increase their lead at the top to 23 points .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: police dog ivy campaign : calls for chief constable to resign
text: a petition has been launched calling for the chief constable of west mercia police to resign because he refused to let one of the force 's dogs retire with her handler .
sergeant david evans wanted to buy police dog ivy so he could keep her when he retired and a campaign to help him has raised thousands of pounds .
however west mercia police say they are n't allowed to accept such money and ivy is continuing to do very well with her new handler .

documents.title: councils say social care cash 'not enough '
text: more than £ 17m is to be ploughed into adult social care in the county over the next three years .
the money was announced in the budget last week .
shropshire council say their costs go up by £ 8m every year so , although helpful , the money wo n't solve their problems .
telford and wrekin council `` cautiously welcomed '' the extra cash but they also argue it 's not enough .

documents.title: football : chesterfield 1-1 shrewsbury town
text: shrewsbury town took another step closer to safety with a 1-1 draw at chesterfield on saturday .
tyler roberts scored his fourth goal since he moved from west brom on loan , but ian evatt levelled for chesterfield before he was carried off injured .
town boss paul hurst made five changes for the derbyshire clash , as he tried to combat any late season fatigue .
i do n't want to have a first xi and then have lads that only get in the team if we 've got injuries .
so it 's about the squad and i think the lads that came in did well . ''
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: new £ 5 sells for thousands
text: a man in telford has sold a £ 5 note for thousands of pounds .
it 's one of the new notes , with a notable early serial number ending 444 444 .
the closing bid when the online auction ended yesterday was £ 60,100 and 64p for postage .

documents.title: your photos : bright moon over the county
text: we 've been sent some stunning photos of last night 's very bright moon .
thanks to our weather watchers bingoswestry ( top ) and ray ( bottom ) for these snaps .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: shropshire woman injured at trampoline park
text: a woman from oswestry is taking legal action against a trampoline park after fracturing her spine there .
sarah mcmanus , who 's 29 , is one of several people reported to have been seriously injured at flip out in chester .
miss mcmanus jumped from a 12ft ( 3.6m ) tower into a pit of foam sponges during her visit in january .
she had to attract help by throwing them as she could n't speak .
flip out chester says safety is its number one priority and it 's investigating the claims .

documents.title: ice hockey : telford tigers lift league trophy
text: telford tigers celebrated winning the english premier league ( epl ) with a 4-2 win over guildford flames on sunday night .
the win was telford 's 14th in a row , following saturday night 's 4-3 success against sheffield steeldogs .
the epl champions were handed the trophy by english ice hockey association chairman ken taggart , in front of a near-capacity crowd at telford ice rink .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: video : what 's the weather got in store ?
text: after a bright and sunny start , some cloud moving in with highs of 15c ( 59f ) .
you can find a detailed forecast for your area on the bbc weather site .
author: Alex Hamilton
BBC Weather

documents.title: good morning from bbc shropshire
text: i 'm taking a look at the latest news , sport , travel and weather .
if you have a story or to share you can get in touch via email , facebook or twitter .
author: Carlie Swain
BBC Local Live
